benchmark_details.name: MovieSum
benchmark_details.overview: MovieSum is a new dataset for abstractive summarization of movie screenplays, consisting of 2200 movie screenplay-summary pairs. It aims to stimulate research in the area of movie screenplay understanding and summarization.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset to advance research in movie screenplay summarization.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset consists of movie screenplays and their corresponding summaries only in English.

data.source: Collected from various movie screenplay websites and paired with Wikipedia plot summaries.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated following the standard protocols for summarization evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ROUGE scores indicate better summarization performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Lead-512: ROUGE-1: 10.35, ROUGE-2: 1.27, ROUGE-L: 9.84; Longformer: ROUGE-1: 44.85, ROUGE-2: 9.83, ROUGE-L: 43.12.
methodology.validation: The dataset was split into train/validation/test sets for evaluating model performance.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset aims to include a range of movies but may not fully represent all cinematic styles or cultural contexts.
